author: jochembrouwer
content:
Hey all I have a small question how to handle RPC requests before we have forked. For instance https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/eth/fee_market.yaml

`eth_feeHistory` already has specs for blob transactions. However these are not yet on mainnet. How should we proceed implementing this? "Just" follow the spec and thus return 0s per the spec for the blob gas fee? Or should we omit these fields pre-fork?

author: sky.cactus
content: Historically this sort of behavior has been "undefined" leading up to a fork.  It would be great to see it well defined this time around though!

author: ryanleeschneider
content: I feel like omitting the fields pre-fork is cleaner, but recognize that hasn't always been the way RPCs have been implemented in the past.
